definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)

sentences.english: He's just been setting up a bachelor party, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说他刚才在布置一个单身汉派对的会场。

sentences.english: I guess he's sort of a miser like most bachelors .
sentences.chinese: 我想他一定是个吝啬鬼，象大部分单身汉一样。

sentences.english: It's a bachelor pad and play pen in one.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个单身汉垫和发挥笔于一体。

sentences.english: Woah, all you singletons, ohh, even the white kids.
sentences.chinese: 哇，所有单身汉们，甚至白人小孩们。

sentences.english: Bookish bachelor seeking single Noetic Scientist?
sentences.chinese: 书呆子单身汉在追求单身的抽象的科学家？

sentences.english: Mr Utterson came home to his bachelor house in sombre spirits.
sentences.chinese: 厄塔森先生回到他那单身汉的家里，心情烦躁。

sentences.english: Poor bachelors are often victims of violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的单身汉常常是暴力犯罪的受害者。

sentences.english: Two womanizing bachelors fall in love with twin sisters who run a sex addiction clinic.
sentences.chinese: 两个沉溺于女色的单身汉爱上孪生姐妹运行性瘾诊所。

sentences.english: Better a bachelor 's life than a slovenly wife.
sentences.chinese: 单身汉的生活好于有一个懒散的妻子。

sentences.english: He says that the just-right wife is someone else's wife.
sentences.chinese: 单身汉说，理想的妻子是别人的妻子。

sentences.english: For Chinas lonely hearts, Spring Festival can be a psychological nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 对中国的单身汉来说，春节将是一场心理上的噩梦。

sentences.english: A single man of large fortune; four or five thousand a year.
sentences.chinese: 一个有钱的单身汉，每年四五千英镑。

sentences.english: It is equivalent to every male in the UK dying a bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 它等同于英国每一个男性对应一个垂死的单身汉。

sentences.english: But these developments have worsened the predicament for bachelors.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些改善加剧了单身汉的窘况。

sentences.english: Wexner then began thinking—as a bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 瓦克斯纳开始思考，像单身汉一样思考。

sentences.english: SINGLE men in possession of a good fortune, it's said, must be in want of a wife.
sentences.chinese: 俗话说的好，凡是有钱的单身汉，总是想讨个老婆的。

definition: lit. fifth child of the Wangs/bachelor
fig. unmarried person/single person (especially one who is comfortable financially)
young people in their late 20s or older who are still unmarried
(Internet slang) person who is neither married nor in a relationship (used self-deprecatingly)
"leftover woman" (successful career woman who has remained single)
